meanings.definition: Add color to (a black and white photograph)
meanings.sent1: She was colorising the old family photos to make them look more vibrant.
meanings.sent2: The artist spent hours colorising the black and white images to bring them to life.
meanings.sent3: After colorising the picture, it looked like a rainbow had exploded on it!
meanings.sent4: Her talent for colorising photos turned the dull images into masterpieces.
meanings.sent5: The process of colorising the photograph made the memories feel more real.

meanings.sent1: The flowers in the garden were colorising the landscape beautifully.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed colorising her drawings with bright markers.
meanings.sent3: The little girl was colorising her coloring book with great enthusiasm.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a paintbrush colorising the story he was telling.
meanings.sent5: The sunset was colorising the sky with shades of pink and orange.
